Abstract. As the core part of fully polarization radiometer, the digital correlator
is used to make correlation of polarization channels to get all the stokes
parameters. Based on the newest Field-Programmable Gate Array
(FPGA)-Virtex6 made by Xilinx and high-speed A / D converter
(ADC12D1800), design method of digital correlator is introduced in the paper
with bandwidth of 1.6 GHz with 12 bit resolution. The effect number of bit in the
system that has been completed is above 9 bit. Different with the other correlator,
the novel correlator is used to make dual frequency-band correlation to output
two group of stokes parameters. The structure of interfacing circuit, data
processing and control system of the main modules are presented in detail.
Keywords: FPGA, Fully Polarimetric Microwave Radiometer, ADC,
High-Speed Digital Correlation.
Polarimetric radiometer has the ability of obtaining the results of ocean wind field, the
cloud water content, water vapor, sea surface temperature and other parameters in large
area. Getting atmosphere-ocean parameters with short repeat cycle is quite favorable
for ocean and climate research and improving the atmosphere and ocean forecasting
model accuracy[1]. The core data processing and design of digital correlator are
introduced in the paper. The radiometer has two receivers. After two channel signals
pass through mixer, IF amplification, respectively each signal is divided into two same
signals, namely I and Q, one of which is 90

digital correlator. The block diagram of fully polarimetric radiometer is shown in
Fig. 1. Previous correlation always use analog correlator, but the digital correlator has
the advantage of highly integrated featureis without channel coupled. Another feature
of this design is completing two bandwidth calculations in a digital correlator to get two
stokes parameters. According to Nyquist sampling law, the sampling frequency must
be greater than twice the bandwidth of the sampled signal in order to avoid loss of
information, which makes the sampling circuit with high frequency.

This paper presents a highly reliable signal sampling and correlation processing
system, which can complete 0.8GHz bandwidth distortion-free sampling for 1.6GHz
bandwidth correlation processing. The system uses high-speed ADC, ADC12D1800.
Data receiving and calculating is completed in FPGA-Virtex6 core.
Block diagram of the digital correlator is shown in figure 2. Virtex-6 is designed in the
center with four ADCs symmetrical place. The two ADCs on one side complete
one-bandwidth polarization channels IQ sample. Two bandwidths sampled data are
translated to FPGA, correlated respectively. Each ADC outputs a clock signal and an
OR signal, which is the signal to indicate the out of range by external light. When the
ADC input is out of range, the light is asserted. The clock-driven part is located in the
central for the same length to all the ADCs. Powers are placed in the edge of the chip to
reduce interference. RS485 is used for transmission with the computer.

Design of 1.6GHz Bandwidth Four-Channels Digital-Correlator Based on FPGA
ADC12D1800 is an analog to digital conversion chip with maximum performance from
U.S. National Semiconductor Corporation. The typical power consumption is 4.4W.
Each channel sampling rate is 1.6GHz in the digital correlator with 12bit resolution,
full-power bandwidth of 2.8GHz, the input peak value of 800mV
[2]. Chip can be stable
in the negative 40 degrees to 85 degrees. Its block diagram is shown in Figure 3. After
sampling the 1:2 multiplexer module can be selected for the output with output divided
clock signal. ADC clock output can be selected with single edge or double edge output
of two transmission. The design uses double edge output, so that the output clock o
frequency is 400MHz as the following FPGA master clock. ADC has two configuration
modes such as pin configuration and programming configuration. Through the FPGA
to connect the enable, clock, data pins in third-line, programming is completed. The
design uses direct pin configuration, which is directly related to the low then high of
configuration pin. The PCB design should be given special attention.
Four ADC clock signals synchronization is related to the entire design accuracy.
Clock can be produced in two ways, first by the ADF4367, and second by the external
clock input. ADF4367 is a chip PLL frequency synthesizer from ADI with the
frequency range from 350mhz to 1800mhz, and the output frequency can be divided to
175mhz-900mhz. ADF4367 is controlled by the FPGA. Clocks are output from the
ADCLK948 to the ADCs as sampling clock with another way to the FPGA to control
the synchronous reset of the four ADCs. ADCLK948 principle structure is shown in
Figure 4 with two optional inputs, up to eight clock fan-out. The maximum input
frequency is 4.8GHz, which fully meets the application requirement.

Virtex6 series use third-generation ASMBL architecture of 40nm manufacturing p
rocess with lower power consumption than the previous generation by up to 50%
and cost reduction up to 20% [3]. The series was the most suitable combination
of optimization, including flexibility, hard IP, transceiver function and developme
nt tool support. The new devices are operated at 1.0v core voltage, as well as opt
ional 0.9v low-power version. SXT series of Virtex-6 have ultra-high performance
DSP, which is suitable for high-speed large-scale computing applications. XC6V
SX315T-1FFG1156C is used in this design with the maximum clock frequency u
p to 600MHz [4]. Figure 5 shows the data flow diagram for the FPGA chip, mai
nly consisting of FPGA reset part, IO port buffer, 1:2 multiplexers, correlation, st
ate machine and reset module of the ADC.
Fig. 5. Data flow diagram for the FPGA
Reset of the FPGA chip is asserted by MAX811 from the external drive and manual
button with low signal to reset the FPGA. The data access to IO port are first translated
to BUFFER with LVDS signal changed to single-ended signal buffer, which is directly
completed by the hard-core inside FPGA. The 400MHz master clock can not be used
directly for data control. It is needed to down- frequency by 1:2 multiplexer in FPGA.
Through such transmission, input data are changed to into eight groups for four sets.
Then the data are translated to correlation part controlled by 200MHz. Divide work is
completed by the the DCM clock driver module in Virtex6. DCM module can not only
synchronize the clock, phase, frequency and frequency transform, but also can reach
the global clock output with jitter-free delay. FPGA computing process is shown as the
following formula for each band. 1_DI indicates the I channel signal of one
polarization; 1_DQ indicates the Q channel signal of one polarization. 2_DI indicates
the I channel signal of the other polarization; 2_DQ indicates the Q channel signal of
the other polarization.

The IP core in FPGA can be used to design 12-bit width multiplier and 8-bit × 1024
synchronization FIFO. The 48-bit width accumulator is programmed by the VHDL[5].
Figure6 is the IP core correlation flow for real-correlation, which needs two multipliers,
one adder and one accumulator. After accumulating 10 ms (controllable), the
correlation results are translated to PC via the serial output in a sequence of V-channel
self-correlation, H-channel self-correlation, real part of cross-correlation and imaginary
part of cross-correlation. The ADC has a capability to precisely reset its DCLK output
as determined by the DCLK_RESET pulse, which is controlled by FPGA. This allows
multiple ADCs in the system to have their output clocks at the same time. The reset
control is completed by FPGA. Serial port is designed in the system. The serial
connection is completed in accordance with requirements. RS232 chip selects the
MAX3232 with two pairs of signal driver. RS485 driver chip is SP3491. It has two
pairs of differential drivers and the corresponding enable pin. Enable pins are
controlled by the FPGA. Input and output pins are connected to FPGA.

The main PCB characteristics of the device are high-density and high-speed. The
analog and digital hybrid circuit design theory must be strictly followed.
1. The PCB should be divided into analog and digital circuit[7]. The AD contains
analog and digital circuits. There are should no digital circuit above analog part, also no
analog circuit above digital part.
2. All the clock and data outputs are differential. The termination resistors should be
placed across the ports to insure 100 ohm impedance matching with the error less than
10 ohm.
H. Lu et al.
3. For best result signal lines should not cross the gap between the ground margin and
the power margin unless the signal is close to a large area layer.
4. The adjacent two lines should be perpendicular to each other as much as possible,
or take a slash. The large area of the power layer and large area of ground should be
close to play the role of filtering[8].
Fully polarimetric microwave radiometer is a new kind of passive microwave remote
sensor. The new technology feature of fully polarimetric radiometer is using multiple
correlation technology to process correlation between horizontal and vertical
polarization signals in order to get the Stokes vectors. In the paper, one FPGA-Virtex6
and four high-speed ADCs are used to complete 1.6GHz sampling and digital
correlation. The system can satisfy dual bandwidth correlation up to 1.6GHz. The
digital correlator has the characteristics of low power and small size. The power is
below 25W. The Effective number of bits is above 9bit.
